newsitem.title: USA: Bonneville next-day firm power sold only in blocks.
newsitem.headline: Bonneville next-day firm power sold only in blocks.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration will sell next-day firm power only for blocks of light load hours (0100-0500, 2300-2400 PDT), heavy load hours (0700-2200) and flat (all day), the agency said Thursday.
The Friday price for the heavy-load blocks is $19.25 per megawatt hour (MWh) for Northwest deliveries, up from $18.50 for Thursday pre-schedulings.
But Bonneville slightly reduced its peak, firm price for California border deliveries to $20.00 per MWh from $20.50.
BPA also slightly raised its off-peak firm prices to $16.00 to $19.25 in the Northwest, compared with $16.00 to $18.00, and to $16.00 to $20.00 for the California border, also up from $16.00-$18.00.
Bonneville's prices for non-firm next-day power still allow buyers to pick and choose volumes at $19.50 for peak Northwest deliveries and $20.00 for peak California border deliveries.
